name: Champion
description:
A Ruler risen from the ranks of their people.Mortal Champions have access to unique army leadership hero skills.Mortal Champion rulers gain +20% Experience
Start with +100 Relations with Free Cities.Mortal Champion rulers start with the Command ability in CombatMortal Champions are CHampion Governors.

name: Wizard King
description: <bulletlist>A powerful Wizard seeking dominion over a new realm.<bullet>Wizard Kings have access to unique Combat Spell enhancing hero skills.</bullet><bullet>All <conduit></conduit> Conduits grant +2<mana></mana> Mana.</bullet><bullet>Start with +10 Combat Casting points and +10 World Map Casting Points</bullet><bullet>Wizard Kings start with the Channeling Ritual ability in combat</bullet><bullet>Wizard Kings are Wizard Governors.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Dragon Lord
description: A mighty Dragon seeking new realms to shape in their vision.Dragon Lords have access to unique combat Hero Skills.Dragon Lords gain powerful Transformation Hero Signature Skills based on empire Affinities.Gain extra Gold with Dragon Hoard.Dragon Lords are Dragon Governors.Dragon Lords have 30 Gold Unit Upkeep and cannot equip most Hero Items.

name: Eldritch Sovereign
description: <bulletlist>An eldritch Ruler with powers beyond mortal comprehension.<bullet>Eldritch Sovereigns have access to powerful control Hero.</bullet><bullet>Eldritch Sovereigns gain powerful unique Hero Signature Skills.</bullet><bullet>Use <thralls></thralls> Thralls to cast powerful ritual Spells.</bullet><bullet>Start with Clairvoyance Ritual and Enthrall Population</bullet><bullet>Eldritch Sovereigns have a 5 <mana></mana> Mana Unit Upkeep and cannot equip Leg and Mount items</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Giant King
description: <bulletlist>A formidable Giant refashioning realms with the elemental force of the Clan of Fire, Rock, Storm, or Frost</bulletlist>

name: Feudal - Monarchy
description: <bulletlist>Your people are loyal to the absolute rule of their Monarch, gaining power from the presence of their ruler:<bullet>Units gain For the Monarch.</bullet><bullet>Certain units can promote to higher Tier units on attaining Legendary Rank.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Feudal - Aristocracy
description: <bulletlist>Your cities form powerful Houses, able to field efficient armies when led by their Liege Lords:<bullet>Each city has a Feudal House led by its governor, who becomes the House's Liege Lord.</bullet><bullet>Units produced in Feudal cities become part of that city's Fedual House, gaining<xp></xp> Expierience as their Liege Lord gains <renown></renown> Renown.</bullet>Certain units can promote to higher Tier units on attaining Legendary Rank.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Barbarian
description: <bulletlist>A people who thrive on war and aggression. They value strength and prefer to charge head-on into bloody battles.<bullet>Structures with <food></food> Food and <draft></draft> Draft income.</bullet><bullet>Melee units have Primal Strike, dealing extra damage ontheir first strike in combat.</bullet><bullet>Ritual of Alacrity passive</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Industrious
description: <bulletlist>Master builders who value grand cities and strong armor, preferring a defensive attitude over an aggressive one.<bullet>Structures with <production></production> Production income.</bullet><bullet>Through Bolstering, units get sturdier as they get hit in battle.</bullet><bullet>Scout Prospecting passive</bullet></bulletlist>

name: High
description: <bulletlist>A highly developed society whose members strive for harmony. When threatened, however, they wield their guiding light as a weapon.<bullet>Structures have <happiness></happiness> City Stability and <knowledge></knowledge> Knowledge income.</bullet><bullet>Units are strengthened with Awakened, revealing their hidden potential</bullet><bullet>+10 <reputation6></reputation6> Alignment.<bullet>Alignment Agenda passive</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Dark
description: <bulletlist>A dictatorial civilization where the strong and ruthless dominate the weak. They use forbidden magics to maintain control and weaken their enemies.<bullet>Cities can negate <happiness></happiness> City Stability income penalties.</bullet><bullet>Unique City Structures granting <research></research> Knowledge and extra income from Prisons and Crypts.</bullet><bullet>Units specialize in inflicting negative status effects and exploiting them with Cull the Weak.</bullet><bullet>-10 <reputation2></reputation2> Alignment.</bulletlist>

name: Mystic - School of Attunement
description: <bulletlist>Your people are versatile spellcasters, attuned to the arcane:<bullet>Units gain Attunement: Star Blades.</bullet><bullet>Collect Astracl Echoes through exploration and research</bullet><bullet>Use Echo Casting to cast spells beyond normal limits</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Mystic - School of Potential
description: <bulletlist>Your people are experimental spellcasters, seekeing knowledge in the arcane:<bullet>Combat Spells are always Overcharged the first time they are cast each combat</bullet><bullet>Use spells to exploit Arcane Inspiration and gain an exonomic edge.</bullet><bullet>This culture's units inflict Dissonance with their attacks</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Mystic - School of Summoning
description: <bulletlist>Your people are powerful summoners, specializing in magical creatures:<bullet>Magic Origin units gain Attunement: Astral Resonance</bullet><bullet>Collect Astral Echos through exploration and research.</bullet><bullet>Use Echo Infusion to rank up your Magic Origin units rapidly.</bullet><bullet>This culture's units gain Astral Connection.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Oathsworn - Oath of Strife
description: <bulletlist>Your people follow a path of Strife, seeking to forge their strength in the fires of war:<bullet>Gain grievances against Rulers with an overall better ranking</bullet><bullet>Razing Cities and Pillaging Provinces takes -1 <turn></turn> Turn.</bullet><bullet>Razing Cities and Pillaging Provinces yields <influence></influence> Imperium.</bullet><bullet>Culture units have Warrior's Soul.</bullet><bullet>Become stronger as you gain Devotion to the Oath of Strife.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Oathsworn - Oath of Righteousness
description: <bulletlist>Your people follow a path of Righteousness, working to be a positive force for good upon the world:<bullet>Negative <evil></evil> alignment gained is doubled.</bullet><bullet>Culture units have Nobility.</bullet><bullet>Become stronger as you gain Devotion to the Oath of Righteousness.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Oathsworn - Oath of Harmony
description: <bulletlist>Your people follow a path of Harmony, seeking cooperation and to clear the world of threats:<bullet>Gain +100 relations with Free Cities and Rulers</bullet><bullet>When vassalizing a conquered city, they start at Vassalage phase instead of Tributary.</bullet><bullet>Culture units have Harmonize.</bullet><bullet>Become stronger as you gain Devotion to the Oath of Harmony.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Reaver
description: <bulletlist>A society of industrial opportunists. Pragmatic and brutal, they combine the material and the arcane, expanding their dominion through conquests and hunts. <bullet>Structures have <production></production> Production and <mana></mana> Mana income.</bullet><bullet>Units are specialized in focusing down Marked targets with Focused Aggression.</bullet><bullet>-1 <whisperingstone></whisperingstone> Whispering Stone.</bullet><bullet>Total War</bullet><bullet>War Spoils</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Primal - Mire Crocodile
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Mire Crocodile, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in SwampSwamp provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +3 FoodAccess to the Primal Crocodile summonUnits have:Status Effect Immunity: DiseasedSwamp WalkMire Crocodile's Boon

name: Primal - Storm Crow
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Storm Crow, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in GrasslandsGrassland provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +2 ManaAccess to the Primal Crow summonUnits have:Grassland WalkStorm Crow's Boon

name: Primal - Glacial Mammoth
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Glacial Mammoth, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in ArcticAble to build Farms on Snow terrainSnow provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +3 Production Access to the Primal Mammoth summonUnits have:Arctic WalkGlacial Mammoth's Boon

name: Primal - Dune Serpent
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Dune Serpent, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in the DesertAble to build Farms on Sand terrainSand provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +2 Gold Access to the Primal Serpent summonUnits have:Sand WalkDune Serpent's Boon

name: Primal - Ash Sabertooth
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Ash Sabertooth, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in AshlandsAble to build Farms on Ashlands terrainAshland provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +3 Gold Access to the Primal Sabertooth summonUnits have:Desolate WalkAsh Sabertooth's Boon

name: Primal - Tunneling Spider
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Tunneling Spider, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in the UndergroundAble to build Farms on Cavern terrainMushroom Forest provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +2 Knowledge Access to the Primal Spider summonUnits have:Cave WalkTunneling Spider's Boon

name: Primal - Sylvan Wolf
description:
A people who worship powerful Animal Spirits and channel their Fury during battle. They receive blessings by altering their environment. Structures have Food income.Alter privinces into the Primal Animal's Favored Terrain

Your people worship the Sylvan Wolf, bestowing benefits to your culture: Start in the ForestForest provinces are Favored Terrain and gain: +3 Draft Access to the Primal Wolf summonUnits have:Forest WalkSylvan Wolf's Boon

name: Dwarfkin
description: Stout, hardy and stubborn beings who are used to living in the most rugged regions of their world.

name: Elfkin
description: Slender, pointy-eared beings whose kin were the first to inhabit the realms.

name: Feline
description: Cat-like beings who move with feline grace.

name: Goblinoid
description: Small, hunched beings who love to rampage around in groups. Some are strangely fascinated by sheep.

name: Avian
description: Feathered, beaked beings whose families are usually referred to as 'Nests'. Their sing-song calls can carry over entire forests.

name: Syron
description: Slender, pale beings whose origins lie within the deep dark of the Astral Sea.

name: Ogrekin
description: Imposing beings whose teeth can grow to sizes almost as impressive as their horns.

name: Simian
description: Tailed primates to whom a smile can mean both a sign of friendship or aggression.

name: Insectoid
description: Carapaced beings who communicate through a combination of sound and subtle chemical odors.

name: Halfling
description: Stocky, happy-go-lucky beings who enjoy wild adventures just as much as a well-deserved nap.

name: Human
description: Humanoid beings who are organized and entrepreneurial, albeit impatient at times.

name: Molekin
description: Beings who have evolved from underground dwellers and retain their heightened sense of touch.

name: Orcoid
description: Passionate and strong beings who have faced great prejudice as a result of their kin's history.

name: Ratkin
description: Rodent-like beings whose groups are often referred to as mischiefs.

name: Toadkin
description: Stout amphibian-like beings, born with vocal sacs that allow them to communicate through loud croaking.

name: Lizardfolk
description: Slender, scaled creatures who use their tongues to get a sense of their surroundings.

name: Goatkin
description: Goat-like beings who take pride in their elaborate horns.

name: Astral Dragon
description:
Breath and Claws deals Lightning Damage

Gain 1 Affinity

name: Chaos Dragon
description:
Breath and Claws deals Fire Damage

Gain 1 Affinity

name: Materium Dragon
description:
Breath and Claws deals Physical Damage

Gain 1 Affinity

name: Nature Dragon
description:
Breath and Claws deals Blight Damage

Gain 1 Affinity

name: Order Dragon
description:
Breath and Claws deals Spirit Damage

Gain 1 Affinity

name: Shadow Dragon
description:
Breath and Claws deals Frost Damage

Gain 1 Affinity

name: Rock Giant King
description: An adament Giant who sculpts realms raising mountains.<bulletlist><bullet>Capital city starts with Wizard Tower: Item Forge</bullet><bullet>Has the Summon Rock Runestele spell.</bullet><bullet>Provinces with Mountains or Stalagmites provide +3 <production></production> Production.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings are Giant King Governors.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings have a 5 <mana></mana> Mana Unit Upkeep and cannot equip Mount items.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Fire Giant King
description: A searing Giant who cleaves realms by molding lava.<bulletlist><bullet>Capital city starts with Wizard Tower: Item Forge</bullet><bullet>Has the Summon Lava Runestele spell.</bullet><bullet>Can build <farm></farm> Farms on Ashlands.</bullet><bullet>Provinces with Lava or Lava Chasms provide +2 <production></production> Production and don't apply the extra <happiness></happiness> City Stability penalty normally found in these.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings are Giant King Governors.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings have a 5 <mana></mana> Mana Unit Upkeep and cannot equip Mount items.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Storm Giant King
description: A thunderous Giant who evens out realms by flattening peaks<bulletlist><bullet>Capital city starts with Wizard Tower: Item Forge</bullet><bullet>Has the Summon Storm Runestele spell.</bullet><bullet>Provinces with Rivers of Water provide +1 <food></food> Food and +1 <mana></mana> Mana.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings are Giant King Governors.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings have a 5 <mana></mana> Mana Unit Upkeep and cannot equip Mount items.</bullet></bulletlist>

name: Frost Giant King
description: A glacial Giant who reshapes realms by driving snow.<bulletlist><bullet>Capital city starts with Wizard Tower: Item Forge</bullet><bullet>Has the Summon Ice Runestele spell.</bullet><bullet>Can build <farm></farm> Farms on Snow.</bullet><bullet>Provinces with Snow or Ice +2 <mana></mana> Mana.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings are Giant King Governors.</bullet><bullet>Giant Kings have a 5 <mana></mana> Mana Unit Upkeep and cannot equip Mount items.</bullet></bulletlist>
